metadata.title: CVE-2022-2566 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds memory write exists in FFMPEG since version 5.1. The size calculation in `build_open_gop_key_points()` goes through all entries in the loop and adds `sc->ctts_data[i].count` to `sc->sample_offsets_count`. This can lead to an integer overflow resulting in a small allocation with `av_calloc()`. An attacker can cause remote code execution via a malicious mp4 file. We recommend upgrading past commit c953baa084607dd1d84c3bfcce3cf6a87c3e6e05

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavcodec59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavdevice59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavfilter8 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat-extra59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavformat59 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libavutil57 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libpostproc56 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
libswscale6 - 7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: ccdm94> vulnerability introduced by commit ab77b878f12. Affected version is version 5.1, when it includes the code from this commit.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:5.1.1-1ubuntu1').
